The name '''Míriel''' means "Jewel-daughter" in [[Quenya]], from ''[[mír]]'' ("jewel") and ''[[-iel]]'' ("daughter"). Her ''[[epessë]]'' '''[[Þerindë]]''', or '''Serindë''' in the [[Quenya]] of [[Tirion]], means "the Broideress", referring to her great skill in embroidery for 'her chief talent was a marvelous dexterity of hand'<ref>The Peoples of Middle Earth; The Shibboleth of Feanor, Page 333</ref> which she applied to her skill of embroidery, 'achieving in what even the Eldar thought haste' embroidery that 'was finer and more intricate than any that had before been seen'<ref>The Peoples of Middle Earth; The Shibboleth of Feanor, Page 333</ref>. It was her Mother Name<ref>The Peoples of Middle Earth; The Shibboleth of Feanor, Page 333</ref>. It is to be noted that she preferred and requested her kin use the older pronunciation of Þerindë, and that her son upheld the use of Þ over s out of respect and in her memory<ref>The Peoples of Middle Earth; The Shibboleth of Feanor, Page 336</ref>.
